summary: Email chain between the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) regarding redactions to the Jeffrey Epstein autopsy report and related files. The USAO-SDNY requests withholding of certain materials (scene photos, 360 scan) related to an ongoing federal investigation.

persons.name: Florence Hutner
persons.role: General Counsel, Office of Chief Medical Examiner
persons.context: Primary correspondent from OCME, handling redaction requests from federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein autopsy file.

persons.name: Rebekah
persons.context: Correspondent from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, making requests to redact and withhold materials from the Epstein autopsy file to protect an ongoing investigation.

connections.description: Engaged in email correspondence regarding the handling and redaction of the Jeffrey Epstein autopsy report and related investigative materials.

events.title: Initial Redaction Request
events.description: Rebekah from USAO-SDNY sends an initial secure message to Florence Hutner at OCME requesting redactions to the Epstein file.

events.title: Clarification on Redaction Scope
events.description: Florence Hutner seeks clarification from USAO-SDNY on whether their request to withhold scene photos includes the 360 scan and whether the restriction is temporary or permanent.

events.title: Revised Report Sent
events.description: USAO-SDNY sends a revised version of the OCME report and file to Florence Hutner, having removed one specific redaction as requested, and provides language for OCME to notify recipients about the redactions.

locations: 421 E. 26th Street, New York, NY 10016 (Office of Chief Medical Examiner)
MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center, implied location of a voicemail)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) was actively involved in requesting redactions to the Jeffrey Epstein autopsy report in September 2019.
Materials requested to be withheld included scene photographs and a 360-degree scan from the autopsy, to protect an ongoing federal criminal investigation.
The correspondence indicates the federal investigation into matters related to Epstein's death was still active as of September 2019.
OCME, while cooperating, noted it would comply with any future court orders for the unredacted file, but would notify the USAO first.
A specific redaction was removed from the report at OCME's request, showing a back-and-forth negotiation over the file's contents.
